questions.question: Acronym for World Wide Web.
questions.explanation: WWW is the system for accessing web pages over the Internet.

questions.question: Acronym for HyperText Transfer Protocol.
questions.explanation: HTTP is the protocol used for transmitting web pages.

questions.question: Unique numerical address identifying a device on a network.
questions.explanation: IP addresses identify devices for communication on networks.

questions.question: Acronym for Uniform Resource Locator.
questions.explanation: URL is the web address used to access online resources.

questions.question: Acronym for Domain Name System.
questions.explanation: DNS translates domain names into IP addresses.

questions.question: Software used to access and view websites.
questions.explanation: Web browsers like Chrome and Firefox display web pages.

questions.question: Company that provides internet access to customers.
questions.explanation: ISPs provide the connection to access the Internet.

questions.question: Website that helps find information on the Internet.
questions.explanation: Search engines like Google index and search web content.

questions.question: Maximum rate of data transfer in a network connection.
questions.explanation: Bandwidth determines how much data can be transferred per second.

questions.question: Protocol used to send email messages.
questions.explanation: SMTP handles the sending of emails between servers.
